alert.note: Alert for Barnes; Cass; Ransom; Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 30 at 12:34AM CDT until June 30 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Forks has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Clay County in northwestern Minnesota... Northern Wilkin County in west central Minnesota... Northeastern Ransom County in southeastern North Dakota... Cass County in southeastern North Dakota... Southeastern Barnes County in southeastern North Dakota... Northwestern Richland County in southeastern North Dakota... * Until 115 AM CDT. * At 1233 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Alice to near Wolverton, moving northeast at 50 mph. A 59 mph wind gust was measured near Leonard at 12:28 AM CDT. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fargo, Moorhead, West Fargo, Dilworth, Barnesville, Horace and Casselton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 41 and 82. Interstate 94 in North Dakota between mile markers 307 and 352. Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 1 and 29. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
